text: RECODE provides information about programmed frameshifting, read-through and bypassing, based on published results in the literature (Baranov et al., 2001; Bekaert et al., 2010) . The database utilizes information from âˆ¼1500 known frameshifted gene products. A majority of the data on frameshifting comes from two frameshifted proteins, RF2 and antizyme, and is constantly updated using the respective prediction tools [ARFA (Bekaert et al., 2006) and OAF (Bekaert et al., 2008) , respectively]. PseudoViewer is used for visualization of pseudoknot structures. (http://recode.ucc.ie)
